intro: Caperonia subrotunda, commonly known as the round-leaved caper, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and rounded, fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes. Its flowers are often clustered in small inflorescences and are pollinated by insects. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
